intro: Urceola longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled urceola, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique, urn-shaped flowers that are often adorned with prominent sepals. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
